title: High quality pic of commander keen??
content:
Hello,

i really like the games Commander Keen. But i was looking for a high quality picture of commander keen because i want to make a shirt for myself. i already got a picture but it is too small and it will not be very good when it's large. an example of the picture

[img]http://www.petitionspot.com/uploads/645-keenp.gif[/img]

maybe someone could help me out here. on the 3drealms forum

[url=http://forums.3drealms.com/ubbthreads/showflat.php?Cat=0&Number=878812&an=0&page=0#878812]forums.3drealms.com/ubbth...e=0#878812[/url]

they recommended me to ask if someone here has such a picture or maybe can photoshop the picture of keen with his tumb up in a higher resolution.

greetz [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
casper
the netherlands

title: Re: High quality pic of commander keen??
content:
I was going to make a Commander Keen shirt a few months ago(wanted one since I was like 3). All I could find though was the "Aliens Ate my Babysitter" high rez pics off of the 3d realms site (or wherever). Unfortunately the size was not quite big enough to print. It would only come out to like 5 by 4 inches. (350 dpi)

I was going to make my own shirt. But then it would be in my style and not the official Commander Keen style. If I ever finish it though, I will be sure to upload the pic so you can make your own.

If you want the thumbs up pose, I suggest you draw over the pic or something. That picture is not in high rez anywhere. I could probably do it but I am doing other things at the moment. Maybe later.-----------------------
"The Adventures of Commander Keen" issue #1: coming soon.

title: Hmm...
content:
Perhaps a 400% increased title screen could work? It becomes about 45x30cm at 72dpi. Maybe apply a couple of filters... I couldn't find any in Photoshop 6 that do the right job, but I'm sure there's something out there... something like the antialiasing effect DOSBox uses would be ideal (see [url=http://andy.durdin.net/keen/modding/viewtopic.php?t=379]this[/url] K:M topic)?Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

content:
If you blow up one of the title screens to t-shirt size it's easy to tell what it is. Maybe you (or I) could cut out everything but Keen, if that's what you're looking for. I notice that someone on the 3DRealms forum did that too.

I'd like to do a vector version, bur I reinstalled Windows not too long ago and haven't installed an editor yet.________________

title: Re: Classiness.

title: Re: Classiness.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]What'd you use to do that?[hr][/quote]
Mainly [url=http://inkscape.sourceforge.net/]Inkscape[/url]. But because it can't vectorize color pictures, I used [url=http://kolourpaint.sourceforge.net/]KolourPaint[/url] to make seperate pictures for each color. Inkscape didn't vectorize it that nicely, so I had to tweak it somewhat.

content:

[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: Re: High quality pic of commander keen??
content:
Did you import your picture into InkScape and then immediately scale it up, hoping it would be vectorized?

I have never used InkScape before, but I know that wouldn't work.[url=http://www.screenhog.com]www.screenhog.com[/url]

title: Re: High quality pic of commander keen??
content:
Vector graphics is another way to draw pictures. Intead of working with an array of pixels (raster graphics), you draw with lines and curves. You can't just change a bitmap into a vector image. You either need to use your program's autotracing function, which will attempt to create a vector representation of the picture (never perfect; it's just a starting point), or draw over it yourself.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: High quality pic of commander keen??
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]could someone please tell me how to make a image larger using this vector technology?[hr][/quote]
With the picture selected, use the "Trace Bitmap" option under Path. After that you can scale it.

title: Re: High quality pic of commander keen??
content:
I don't think you understand older computer grapchics very well, those older graphics can't be blown up more than 3x without looking really dumb. And "adjusting" it won't help, it will just distort it (I tried in my earlier days).~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...
